content.description: Start standing with hands on the arete and move up to the large horizontal jug on the face.  Find good holds over the top and step over.
content.location: The largest face on the Rocky Road boulder while looking uphill, just off the Chimney Rock trail.

content.description: Sit start with one hand on either side of the large flake. Reach up with your left hand to the smaller flake. Right hand reaches up to the middle of several crimps. Stand up on starting flake. Grab/crimp on one of the jagged rocks on the upper portion of the rock. Top out.

Start all the way to the right on the slab side of the boulder.  With two hands on the vertical rail, push off and make your way along a low and easy traverse across the flat face.  Use crimps and even a pinch to make your way directly horizontal.  (Top of the boulder is off for the traverse.)  Round the corner and fully link into the upper portion of WoosterBooster at the horizontal rail.  Climb the rest of the way up and over the top.
content.location: On the gentle slab side of the Rocky Road boulder, which is a short walk off the Chimney Rock trail.

content.description: A short walk off the Chimney Rock trail while walking the steep uphill section.
